Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2013 07:12PM scaredat45 wrote: Mommy . I am 45 years old . estradiol is what I was on after my surgery my OB took me off the estradiol , I also have a heart problem . the only pain that I feel is that every once in a while I get a sharp pain in the nipple area, I have not had no biopsy's at this point but I am in the process of a breast surgeon I was refered to one by the ob , I had the u/s and the mammogram completed the same day and then was told to waite 6 months to see if any changes, I was going to at first then the shock wore off and I said I didn't want to wait another 6 months to find out since 3 years ago there was a pea size nodule bi-rad 2 then this year I went in I had a 10mmx 5mm in a lymph node of the breast and then 4 nodules for palpable concern that I believe are 5x2 mm each I have green discharge from my breast
Posts.Title: concerned but not diagnosed mommy0608 mommy0608

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2013 08:08PM scaredat45 wrote: I'm not sure what the bi-rads mean . but push the dr for the biopsy if they found something that warrants a 6 month return , This year I caught a head cold that I just cant seem to kick , not sure what the biopsy consist of. im still waiting to get mine . Just go get the mammogram and u/s asap then start from them since you posted earlier ( u had a lymph node biopsy done in 2011 for my the one in your neck (tested me for lymphoma bc ugot really sick) and it came back as b9 hyperplasia........... ) not sure maybe it will be the same testing,
Posts.Title: concerned but not diagnosed mommy0608 mommy0608

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2013 10:30AM - edited Nov 18, 2013 10:31AM by scaredat45 Hi mommy0608 I too had a hysterectomy 2 years ago and was placed on Estradiol hormone replacement for the hot flashes that I received I am 45 and no one on either side of the family have had the problems that I have had . I also have nodules that were found and I am going to a breast surgeon to have them removed as 1 is in a lymph node . but also have a discharge not to scare you , just make sure u do push to get the biopsy asap so that you can have the piece of mind, good luck and hope is b9 for u
Posts.Title: concerned but not diagnosed mommy0608 mommy0608

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2013 08:19AM scaredat45 wrote: Good Morning to all.... on my report it states that a biopsy is the only way to make sure of b9--- if what it states that a (Category 3: Probably benign finding) the key word to me is PROBABLY BENIGN, until I know for sure i'm not taking any more chances my story is as I was told by a dr's assistant in 2011 that the green discharge means ibc the radiologist did mammograms and u/s and a prolactin level test then they saw a small pea size nodule a score of 2 , I was told nothing to worry about come back in a year, I had my hysterectomy that year was put on estradiol for the hot flashes the dose was 2 - 5mg tbs a day that really helped with the flashes . I moved states then went had the same findings on the mamo and u/s but the ob their took me off the estradiol , then a year later I have a total of 5 nodules in my left breast 1 in a lymph node that is the size of 10x5mm , I have pain In the breast and the arm pits also in the rib right below my left breast , so until a dr tells me that I have no invaders to worry about I will push to have them cut out of me.... @camont sorry to hear about your mother . I fully understand my daughter had a friend since kindergarten that was missed diagnosed and just passed away from cancer that took over her whole body don't wait any longer I feel like if there is something in there the only way to know its b9 is to take it out run test better safe than sorry I'm a mother of 3 girls my oldest is 27 and my youngest is 20 I have 5 grandkids ,my 1st husband passed away at a young age so i raised my daughters on my own. then I remarried my husband has little children the youngest is 12 so I will be teaching them all to be proactive in their health care also. @mommy ... yes there is no worse pain then having a hysterectomy , I would of rather had a baby it hurt less,,,,... have a great day everyone 2
